results.title: Rural life of Mexico
results.brief_description: A study of the life of isolated communities in the mountains of Mexico. Living largely by agriculture and using methods of cultivation which have scarcely changed during the centuries, these Mexicans still wear their regional costumes unselfconsciously and dance at fiesta time their traditional dances.
results.description: A study of the life of isolated communities in the mountains of Mexico. results.title: Rural life in Western Ireland: Irish children
results.brief_description: A brother and sister in rural western Ireland help on the farm and in the house; they help to dig turf from the bog, and, together with their family, enjoy a picnic.

results.title: Rural Japan: helping to feed a nation
results.brief_description: Shows the everyday life of the average Japanese farmer, his home and surroundings. Also shows the effects of recent changes on his way of life - the cultivation of plants under hot house conditions, the use of tractors instead of hard manual labour and how rural life has changed since the War with the influence of America.

results.title: Rural industries
results.creator_credit: Motion Picture Associates, Film Australia, Peter Johnson and John Leake
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australia in the 80’s”.
Australia’s modern techniques of cultivation and harvesting are demonstrated to show how this country is a major supplier of grain to the world. The film also shows how the cattle and livestock industry supply food to most parts of the globe.

results.title: Rural and urban poverty: seeds of catastrophe
results.brief_description: Shows how catastrophe is likely to result from the shortfall in food production in developing countries. Looks at rural and urban poverty. Extract from “Five Minutes to Midnight”.

results.title: Rupert Murdoch
results.creator_credit: Australian Broadcasting Commission, Kip Porteous and Ken Hannam
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Five Australians”
Looks at the personal life of Rupert Murdoch the newspaper tycoon, whose career started when he inherited the family company interests. He expanded the business and launched a national paper, The Australian. Members of his family and staff discuss the man they know.

results.title: Rupert Bunny: colour, mood & the senses
results.creator_credit: Lion's Den Productions, Reg McLean and Eugene Schlusser
results.brief_description: A detailed documentary examining the works and background of Australian artist, Rupert Bunny, focussing on the factors which made his work so admired by both collectors and fellow artists. Born in Melbourne, Bunny was one of the few Australian artists painting between the Romantic and Modernist periods to achieve international success by selling works all over the world. While his subjects ranged from mythological characters, seascapes, fairytales, and the spiritual, they all shared a common thread in that their purpose was to appeal to all of the senses. The concept of synthaesthesia - that one sense can be evoked by another - is strikingly evident in the sensuously elegant content of his paintings. A number of art critics offer their opinions on why they believe Bunny is one of the most masterly painters that Australia has ever produced.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Lion’s Den Productions, Reg McLean and Eugene Schlusser

results.title: Rupert and the Runaway Dragon
results.brief_description: Britain’s favourite bear returns with Ping-Pong, Tiger-Lily and all his chums in several delightful; stories, beautifully illustrated and charmingly told. So enter Rupert’s enchanted world where dragons run away, robins turn yellow, eggs hatch firebirds and tree house goblins. Even Father Christmas gets called on for help. Excitement and magic with a very special bear. Rated: G

results.brief_description: Features Paul McCartney’s “Rupert and the Frog” song. Also Linda McCartney’s “The Oriental Nightfish” and delightful award winning “Seaside Woman”. Presented by Paul and Linda McCartney. Rated: G

results.title: Rupert
results.brief_description: Join Rupert in twelve timeless stories where Alred Bestall’s evocative illustrations lead you through a doorway to an enchanted world full of excitement, wonder and magic. Meet the little bear’s old chums Bill Badger, Ping-Pong, Tiger-Lily and Jack Frost as well as dragons, sea-serpents and a host of other fanciful creatures in that land not so far away - by the animal underground railway! Rated: G
